name: NEW YORK YACHT CLUB 70

relatedLinks.title: Herreshoff Legacy: An MIT Museum Project

notes:
The first and largest of the Herreshoff designed New York Yacht Club one-designs. They were lightly built and it said that re-bracing was necessary after the first season. They were also said to be made obsolete by adoption of the Universal handicap Rule in 1903. All were scrapped after a very few years.
Actual names were:
Mineola, Rainbow, Virginia, Yankee (Cornelius Vanderbilt).
